p: The seed is oleaginous and has aleurone sources with a lectin fraction, is an oil that must be refined to be consumed and contains a similar composition to oleic acid, however, the composition may vary according to the geographical location of the plant [ 3]. Seeds are a good source of glucosinalates (8–10%), glycosylate isothiocyanate, 4-(α-L-rhamnosyloxy) benzyl ITC [ 47] and 4-O-(α-L-rhamnopyranosyloxy)-benzylglucosinolate (glucomoringin) [ 25, 47].
